item.title: Track Availability in Application Insights using Logic App Workflow
item.description: I’ve worked with clients following a low-code first strategy where Logic Apps are preferred over .NET solutions. This post shows you how to create custom availability tests using Logic App (Standard) workflows and track the results in Application Insights. This approach gives you access to all Logic App capabilities while requiring minimal code.

item.title: Track Availability in Application Insights using .NET
item.description: Standard availability tests in Application Insights have limitations like no multi-step authentication, no mTLS support and no access to private networks. This post shows you how to create custom availability tests using .NET and Azure Functions to overcome these restrictions while gaining full control over your monitoring logic.

item.title: Track Availability in Application Insights using Standard Test
item.description: When connecting to external systems in integration projects, availability tests help you monitor system uptime, verify security measures are up to date and confirm systems can be reached. This post shows you how to create Application Insights standard tests through Bicep to automate your availability monitoring with infrastructure-as-code.
